thread.title: Horse Racing: Today at Santa Anita, October 8
thread.title_full: Horse Racing: Today at Santa Anita, October 8

title: Horse Racing: Today at Santa Anita, October 8
text:
Horse Racing: Today at Santa Anita, October 8 By Richard Eng 
Post Time 1 p.m. 
Race 1 – 1 mile, Purse $15,000, Claiming $12,500, 3-year-olds and up 
5 Dive Down – Was reclaimed by Eric Kruljac, one of the strongest trainer angles going; third start off an exteneded layoff could be his best. 
6 Doyouknowsomething – Ugly looking chalk exits a couple of awful efforts, but in much better class; reason he is favored is because of the class relief. 
Long Shot – 3 Warren’s Wesley 
Race 2 – 1 1/16th miles, Purse $55,000, Optional claiming $62,500, 3-year-olds and up 
6 Sammy Mandeville – Exits six graded stakes races for this much softer spot; he won’t see anyone who looks like Smooth Roller or Hoppertunity in this field. 
5 Ground Rules – Game win last time when stalked a pedestrian pace and gutted out the victory; the pace could be soft again if Home School goes unchallenged early. 
Long Shot – 4 Solid Wager 
Race 3 – 6 furlongs, Purse $24,000, Claiming $20,000, Fillies and mares, 3-year-olds and up 
1 Always a Chance – Was unlucky to lose last time when left with too much to do in the home stretch; should be able to save ground once again and come flying late. 
4 Lucky Student – Clearly has the goods to go right to the front; they key will be if anyone tries to escort her early, the most likely candidate would be Tough Annie. 
Long Shot – 7 Shared Image 
Race 4 – 6 ½ furlongs (turf, rail at 30 feet), Purse $52,000, Maiden special weights, Cal-breds, Fillies and mares, 3-year-olds and up 
9 Journeyonthemove – Like the cutback in distance from a 2-turn turf route to this down the hill sprint; parking lot post too is another major advantage. 
1 Slew’s Charm – The fact that she is 7/2 odds with her resume tells you something about the rest of this field; chance to cash a check if she shows her best. 
Long Shot – 7 Appealing Lady 
Race 5 – 1 mile, Purse $25,000, Maiden claiming $40,000, 3-year-olds and up 
10 Woody’s Folly – Exits a turf route, but see that all of his races have come in maiden claiming class; my key vote comes from Rafael Bejarano staying loyal. 
3 Poythress – Sliding down the maiden claiming ladder to this new low class; angle could be he did run the best speed figure race of his life here at Santa Anita. 
Long Shot – 4 Architop 
Race 6 – 6 ½ furlongs, Purse $28,000, Starter allowance $40,000, Fillies and mares, 3-year-olds and up 
4 Zanab – Ran a better than looked race in last; it was his dirt debut, so you have to project if he will improve upon that or not, if he does, he is a player. 
7 Hennythelovepenny – Tepid chalk in a wide open affair; Peter Miller has had 9-of-11 starters this meet finish in the money showing all of them were well spotted, live. 
Long Shot – 2 Cadet Roni 
Race 7 – 1 mile (turf, rail at 30 feet), Purse $53,000, Optional claiming $20,000, Cal-breds, Fillies and mares, 3-year-olds and up 
7 Minster’sadventure – Flavien Prat has finished first twice in a row on this filly; unfortunately for him, he is injured and out of action awhile, Rafael Bejarano up. 
3 Awesome Lookn – Has outrun her high odds twice in a row now for Peter Miller; she is only 3/1 odds tonight, but if she improves another step she is right there again. 
Long Shot – 1 Sadie Clare 
Race 8 – 6 furlongs, Purse $21,000, Maiden claiming $30,000, Fillies, 2-year-olds 
3 Gusto’s Gal – Turned in the worst race possible for a 3/1 price horse in last; two angles to consider, Joe Talamo is riding back, her debut race was not half bad. 
4 Reinahermosa – Finished well in last although never threatened to finish better than for minor awards; will need the race to fall apart to have a stronger shot. 
Long Shot – 10 Juju’s Mojo 
Best Bet - 1 Always a Chance (race 3) 
Santa Anita Sunday - Picks/Winners/Mutuels, 17/5/$37.00; Long Shots, 7/2/$13.80; Best Bet, 1/0/$0 
Santa Anita Totals - 104/24/$141.60; Long Shots, 52/11/$156.20; Best Bets, 4/2/$5.60 
SIMULCAST PLAY OF THE DAY - #1 Rumble Doll (2/1) in race 8 at Belmont Park. For scoring purposes, we'll make a hypothetical $2 win, place and show bet, $6 total. On Sunday, Carella ran third at Belmont Park paying $2.50 to show. Stats - 148/98/$735.00; Follow him on Twitter: @richeng4propick Comment section guidelines The below comment section contains thoughts and opinions from users that in no way represent the views of the Las Vegas Review-Journal or GateHouse Media.
